name: Salicylicum acidum
Relationship: Compare: SALOL (rheumatic pain in joints, with soreness and stiffness, headache over eyes; urine violet-smelling; COLCH.; CHINA; LACT-AC. Spiraea and Gaultheria contain salicyl. acid.

Stomach: CANKER SORES, with burning soreness and fetid breath
Putrid diarrhoea; gastrointestinal derangements, especially in children; stools like green frog's spawn
Head: Vertigo; tendency to fall to left side
Headache; confusion in head on rising suddenly
Incipient coryza
Piercing pain in temples
Skin: Itching vesicles and pustules; better by scratching
Extremities: Acute articular rheumatism; worse, touch and motion, profuse sweat
Sciatica, burning pain; worse at night
Copious foot-sweat and ill effects where suppressed

details: The symptoms point to its use in rheumatism, dyspepsia, and MENIERE'S DISEASE. Prostration after influenza; also tinnitus aurium and deafness. Hematuria.
dosage: Third decimal trituration. In acute articular rheumatism, 5 grains very 3 hours. (Old school dose.)
